entry.title: snowy plovers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that female snowy plovers often abandon their families as soon as the chicks hatch?

entry.title: Dave Barney (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Bob and Dave Barney won multiple intramural swimming races, their university recruiter reportedly did not realize they were twins?

entry.title: 8th Session of the Central Committee of the League of Communists of Serbia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the broadcast of the 8th Session of the Central Committee of the League of Communists of Serbia was manipulated to remove or delay speeches critical of Slobodan Milošević?

entry.title: Leonard K. Carson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during World War II, Leonard K. Carson led an air combat school within his fighter unit, called "Clobber College"?

entry.title: a Hawaii TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Hawaii TV station's switch from Japanese-language programming to home shopping stirred viewer outcry?

entry.title: Tshering Tshomo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2023, Tshering Tshomo was the only woman elected to serve in the National Council of Bhutan?

entry.title: Dubliany, Rivne Oblast (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to local legend, the St. Nicholas Church in Dubliany, Rivne Oblast, was built there by accident following a clerical error?

entry.title: stabbed and stomped on Barney the Dinosaur (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that NYPD officers stabbed and stomped on Barney the Dinosaur to cheers from a massive crowd?
